newsitem.title: USA: Home appliance shipments seen slipping in '97-'98.
newsitem.headline: Home appliance shipments seen slipping in '97-'98.

text.p: Major appliance manufacturers project 1997 and 1998 shipments off slightly from the 55 million units shipped in 1996, according to the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers here.

"The record year in 1996 was anticipated but the industry didn't anticipate reaching 55 million units; we think that will steal a little bit from 1997 and 1998," said Bob Holding, AHAM president, in a statement.
This year will be off about three percent at 53,438,000 units, compared to 1996, and 1998 will ease back to 54,299,000, according to the industry forecast.

Automatic washers are projected to be in strong demand over the next two years, with successive record years expected on top of the 1996 record total of 7,129,000 units. Continued introductions of energy efficient, water conserving models are expected to drive this category, the AHAM said.
The industry forecast includes shipments for the U.S. market, whether imported or domestically produced, and export shipments.
